A Minimal Book Example Chapter 1 Prerequisites

A Minimal Book Example Yihui Xie 2020-07-03 Chapter 1 Prerequisites This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandocâ€™s Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.org/tinytex/.
Chapter 2 Introduction No exercises in this chapter.
Chapter 3 The Lasso for Linear Models 3.1 Exercise 2.1

Chapter 3 The Lasso for Linear Models 3.1 Exercise 2.1 We need to show that \[\lambda_\mathrm{max} = \max_j \lvert \frac 1N \langle \boldsymbol{x}_j,\boldsymbol{y}_j\rangle\rvert\] is the smallest \(\lambda\) such that all coefficients are zero.
